answers.author: Jay Gsell
answers.text:
Mark - we are literally dealing with this issue today with the heavy snow , high winds and low temps in WNY near buffalo and 2 great lakes- Erie and Ontario. Our motto is " we Never close". most of our workforce would be considered essential but like you except for continuous operations like Sheriff, Hwy, Jail, NursingHOme, EMS DMV  and DSS we let employees use their discretion and leave credits if they are uncomfortable trying to drive to work. our 500 sq miles provides for some variable conditions within the county and we have 14 facilities including a GA airport to keep operational.The NYS Thruway bisects our County and we have 3 interchanges off the thruway so that engenders more issues with Truck traffic and how to get them safely off the THruway and onto our local reststops till the weather subsides.  In the past selective office closings has been more of a pain and problem with unions than adhering to the above Motto. At least it's not a hurricane or tornado zone , both of which I've lived and worked in in my local government career.

Hi Mark, 
Thanks you for this question on closures. I have a few documents below that you may find helpful but I also hope that other local government officials chime in and share how they deal with the difficult and unpredictable weather that the winter brings. 
Here is an article on how local governments can use telecommuting to both increase productivity and get through harsh weather. http://icma.org/en/BlogPost/1016/Telecommuting_Helps_Weather_the_Storm
"Does your local government tweet?" shows how local governments can use social media to increase transparency and improve communication during government closures. http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9109/public/cover3.cfm?author=craig%20chavez&title=do%20local%20governments%20tweet%3F
I hope you find these documents helpful as your develop your own policy. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz

rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.author: Jeffrey French
answers.text:
Mark, Barron County's policy is to not close unless the County Administrator and Board Chairman concur and this is spelled-out in the County Board Rules and Procedures.  That said, even with the brutally cold temps and wind chills we have chosen to remain open.

answers.author: Michael Embury
answers.text:
Our policy in North Kingstown is not to close unless the Governor declares a state of emergency.  At that time I make a decision whether to pay non-essential personnel (never liked that term) administrative leave or have them take a leave day.  In all other cases, if you cannot make it to work, employees must take a leave day or it is a day w/o pay.

author: Mark Abeles-Allison
text:
Our County has a standing policy not to close.  The issue often comes up in the winter time as heavy snow and cold creates challenges for employees to get to work.  With many of our employees considered essential including Highway, Sheriff, Court, Health, Human Services, etc the topic is even more difficult.   Our general policy is that employees should make their own decisions, and take a leave day if necessary.  I was curious what your policy is?  And how you treat the different employee groups.
Thank you.
title: Closures
